body:
Bar
===
<<if wearing_cloak>>
<<run disturbances += 1>>
This room is pitch black. You are likely to be eaten by a grue.
Something tells you that you should not rummage through the bar in the dark.
-> rummage anyway
   <<run disturbances += 1>>
   you find nothing
   [[stay in bar|Bar]]
   [[back to Foyer|Foyer]]
<<else>>
The lights have turned on. You're at the bar. 
All bottles are empty. Something is written on the floor, in sawdust
[[examine sawdust|Message]]
<<endif>>
[[North (to Foyer)|Foyer]]
title: Bar

body:
Cloakroom
=========
This is the cloakroom of the Opera. There is no clerk behind the counter.
<<if wearing_cloak>>
Behind the counter is a brass hook
-> put cloak on hook
   You get behind the counter, take off your cloak, and put it on the hook.
   Now that you took it off, you get a good look at it.
   Its velvet so perfecly black, Anish Kapoor would sue you!
   <<run wearing_cloak=False>>
   [[back|Cloakroom]]
<<else>>
You can see your unusually dark velvet coat on the brass hook behind the counter.
-> take and wear cloak
   You get behind the counter and put on the cloak.
   For some reason, you feel cold.
   <<run wearing_cloak=True>>
   [[back|Cloakroom]]
<<endif>>
[[East (to Foyer)|Foyer]]
title: Cloakroom

body:
<<if disturbances < 3>>
The message written in sawdust says "YOU WIN"
<<else>>
You try to decipher the letter shapes, but all you can see are your own footprints.
GAME OVER
<<endif>>
title: Message

body:
Foyer
=====
<<if first_time>>
<<run disturbances=0>>
<<run wearing_cloak=True>>
<<endif>>
You are standing in the foyer of the old opera house.
There are exits to the south and west. There is a boarded-up door to the north
[[South<<if visited["Bar"]>> (to Bar)<<endif>>|Bar]]
[[West<<if visited["Cloakroom"]>> (to Cloakroom)<<endif>>|Cloakroom]]
title: Foyer
